newsitem.title: USA: PNC Bank in talks to buy Oppenheimer Co-WSJ.
newsitem.headline: PNC Bank in talks to buy Oppenheimer Co-WSJ.

text.p: New York securities firm Oppenheimer & Co is in talks to be acquired by PNC Bank Corp for as much as $500 million in cash, stock and options, the Wall Street Journal said in Thursday's electronic edition.

According to people familiar with the situation, a deal between Oppenheimer and PNC could be disclosed within a couple of weeks, although there was no formal pact and talks could break down at any time, the Journal said.
The newspaper also said Fleet Financial Group was interested in Oppenheimer and planned to review the firm's books in the next few weeks, according to a person familiar with the matter.
Oppenheimer and PNC were quoted as declining to comment, as was Oppenheimer banker Goldman, Sachs & Co.
Some Oppenheimer executives expected the firm to announce a sale when senior management met managing directors in a meeting previously-scheduled for May 20, the Journal said.
